WRITING.TEXT: NTA, maybe worth sitting them down and talking about it all? Ask why she expects you to put towards, My mum always taught me from a young age "never expect anything for free" Does daughter get any allowance she can put towards? I don't know what it's like over there, but here I had a part time job at the age of 14 and started paying for my own things, at the age of 16 I had two jobs outside of school hours and helped out at home for some extra pocket money, can she not get a part time job? Or offer some chores at home so she can earn it? Don't let them hang this over your head and if she throws a hissy over it, she/the relationship isn't worth it.

If you're in the UK and need to text for help/advice if you can't call, text SHOUT to 85258, it doesn't show up on phone bills and it's a text service with a crisis support volunteer who can help Or if you need to call 08082000247 for ladies, 08088010327 for men, Both numbers give you someone to talk to if you need to vent, offer support and giving you information on local places you can go for help, Don't sit in silence, it doesn't get better, believe me I've been there, I managed to escape with help, you can too.
I'm from Yorkshire and I use mate and jog on alot, wankered I feel should be more in my vocab #129315;

NTA, I call this the "family tax" when working/helping family and they take the p*ss, you get paid as a standard employee so that's what you are, if he wants you to stay etc he should pay you for doing so as he would have to a 'standard employee' do you have a contract? Or is it just a verbal agreement? Everyone has a life outside of work, just because he's family, doesn't mean he can treat you like this.

The 5-4-3-2-1 method, it's a good way to ground yourself and is also used in CBT therapy I believe, I got taught it in school to help during exams if I felt overwhelmed, it also helps take your mind off rapid breathing so that settles down as well, once I've calmed down I take myself away from the situation where possible for 10 mins, 5 things you can see 4 things you can touch 3 things you can hear 2 things you can smell 1 thing you can taste.

WRITING.TITLE: Please be careful!!
WRITING.TEXT: Not sure if this these allowed but these floods are getting worse and dangerous, I have seen several idiots stranded in a flooded area because they think they can drive through, please be sensible and if you wouldn't walk through it, please don't risk driving through it either!! Please think twice if you're ordering from a takeaway tonight as well, it may take longer than expected but please don't blame the driver or the restaurant (I used to work in a takeaway and used to get blamed for the weather) take your time getting home from school/work etc, there will be delays but be thankful you will get to go home in one piece,
I live in south Yorkshire, thankfully for us we aren't flooded this side of town, unfortunately the other side is due to the river Don #128532;
It's taken them until last minute to cancel the event today, all they care about is profit they showed the same mind set I'm 2007.

They're now saying people can stay over night, it's the police that told them to close, apparently anyone who drives they're advising to stay as its unsafe to drive, by the oasis is flooded up to the doors, there's a waterfall over the viaduct, its madness.
Don't forget your life jacket!
Buses aren't much better either.

WRITING.TITLE: Sleep panics
WRITING.TEXT: First time poster, on mobile so please forgive any mistakes, I'm out of the relationship now but it still has effects on me and my mind, I was with him for 5 years, in that time he abused me in many ways, coercive control is one of them, among with sexual abuse, some nights I'd wake up (heavy sleeper) and he'd be doing things and wouldn't stop when I said no, if I tried to move away he'd stop me (bigger and stronger than me) from these incidents I started to have panic attacks in my sleep, if I move whilst I'm asleep and the quilt touched my leg unexpectedly, I wake up being unable to breathe and crying, it's been nearly 2 years since I got emergency removed (took over a year for them to believe me) and even though they arent as common, they still happen, I don't like talking to people about irl, even my current SO doesn't know all of it (There's more) he understands and helps calm me down but I just want them to stop, has anyone else had these? If so have you got any coping methods that you can suggest?

Just eat (UK takeaway app) If I hear "did anyone say just eat" again I think I may go around smashing things, it's on way too much to the point I mute advert breaks if I watch live TV just in case. Edit: Also one on radio at work telling me I don't have to have meat and two veg every night, which is difficult since I work nights anyway, for what it's worth I am a lass in case that's anyway relevant.

I can send some too, now it's getting near christmas mega multi packs are on the shelves, There's different variations, the original or stores own brand, I don't like them so I couldn't tell you the difference but could send a couple of different kinds?

Sometimes the do, I'm sure I'm seen raspberry ones at one point, not sure if still available now but I can have a look, And yep, bigger packs https://www.iceland.co.uk/p/mcvities-100-jaffa-cakes-mega-box/70273.html?fo_c=2200 amp;fo_k=b05164a9f356263e3f70607fa23986c3 amp;fo_s=awin amp;utm_source=aw amp;utm_medium=aff amp;utm_campaign=RedBrain amp;awc=7868_1573819939_c918dbe1bfd2567c96eb4617cef968bc
I'm more than happy to send you some over? I'll have a nosey round and try see if anywhere still has any, not sure if raspberry was Ltd edition or not, haven't seen them for a while.
Regrets

We sit together on an evening and we cuddle or hold hands it's just during the night if I've had a bad day, usually I use the 5-4-3-2-1 method but when I wake from a panic I'm in such a daze I don't know what's going on, my partner pulls me towards him and holds me and reassures me until I calm down I just want them to stop, I'm preparing for one possibly tonight as I've seen my ex earlier today and I had my son with me (not his dad thankfully)

I'm more than happy to send some over :) I know what it's like to not be able to get something, when we go on holiday I try and stock up on paprika lays or bbq crisps but they soon run out and I'm gutted because I can't find any or know anyone in the countries they're available.
Found some where that does raspberry ones and they also do jaffa cake nibbles (bite size balls in a pack)

If that was my bf I would ask if I could either borrow it, or if it would cover both whilst having a cuddle watching some stuffs, Nothing wrong with it, if you're comfy that's all that should matter, I don't understand why it's ok for us to wear our bf's hoodies, tops, shirts etc but not vice versa.

Make the most out of the time with my mum and make sure she knew she was appreciated for everything she did for me and my brother (even though he's a selfish d**head) she died when I was 14 and 15 years later I still feel like I didn't tell her I loved her enough.

Just read an edit she put on that post "I'll be taking to HR tomorrow about the messages I have received" I pretty much doubt HR can/will do anything about the messages and probably will agree that she is an asshole, things outside of work are outside of work, if it happened at work in an office or canteen etc then I'd probably mention it to a colleague and get their opinion instead of running to HR, I'm pretty sure comments like the ones they was making has happened in nearly all companies world wide, she needs to get over herself.

Happy birthday!!! I'm not a fan of my birthday for this reason, it always gets forgotten by family, only one or two of my friends remember and usually its obligatory fb post from them (live miles away, I'm Yorkshire, ones Lincolnshire other is Sussex) I take myself away for the day and have a me day, this year I took myself to Sheffield and to one of the valleys there and just walked and walked, it was cold and wet but it was good to just have a day to clear my mind of thoughts and take myself away from all the hustle and bustle of the town I live in, unfortunately I had to come home earlier than expected due to me being a clutz and fell in the valley and walking in wet shoes and socks was not comfy lol, sometimes you need time alone to find yourself and refresh your mind and get some new perspective, travelling alone can be good, you'll come across challenges and new people who will help bring you out of your shell whilst you find yourself and who you truly are, hope travelling goes well for you and that you're wrapped up warm, it's cold tonight.

NTA, my name is odd, weird and quite unique, even a google brings up no one with my name, I've searched on fb and its only ever brought up 1 person, people say the same to me, I'm english, born in England and lived here all my life yet I always get told I look foreign or should be foreign because of my name (eye roll) I go by a shortened name and I hate meeting new people because they always ask what it's short for and pronounce it wrong after I tell them, she was rude for what she said and to me seems ignorant, many people have weird and wonderful names does she go round saying that to every one she meets thats not a Susan, Jane or a different common name?

You can eat beans out the tin cold, same with custard, smash and ketchup/bbq sauce was filling, salad cream sarnies became a daily snack if hungry, a happy meal was a luxury so was going to my aunts and uncles for a cooked meal, you can make chicken soup from chicken bones and vegetables and it would keep for a couple of days in a slow cooker, Edit: in the UK many years ago, to top up the electric machine we went to the shop and got pink tickets that was #163;1 each, there was a way to trick the machine once you've put it in so you could use it twice and get double the electric,
Anyone know where he hangs out this time of year? Asking for me.

Damn I'm in the UK, bit far to hitch hike unfortunately.
I hope not since I'm late 20's f

Thanks for your comment, I sleep in a total different bed now than I did back then, I even slept in a different bed when I was with him towards the end but unfortunately they still happen, there's no chance of me being able to swap rooms/beds now touch wood I've only had two since this post and that's only because I saw him so it brought everything back,
I think you're right, I've been researching ways to cope and some are helping, guess I've just got to stick with them more, Thanks :D donuts always helps :D

He was in the army, suffered from PTSD and went AWOL, they found him and brought him home, he still suffered years and years later until it got too much and he took his life, we was still close friends but he hid so much from everyone, he was my first serious boyfriend.

I've tried the chores and everything's good for a few days and then it stops, if I didn't cook them anything he wouldn't take them for any fast food as we are currently skint so they would of ended up at their mums and she would of had a go at him which in turn I would then get as well, I've tried not cleaning and managed about a week until I couldn't take it any longer, the problem at the moment is that we don't know when his sons are here or not as they are free to come between, we made a whatsapp group so they could let us know so I could make sure we had enough in but it's hardly been used and I've gave up messaging and asking, I've asked them tonight if they're here tomorrow and their are currently umming and ahhing as they 'don't know yet'

He was at work and I've found out their mum went to get her nails done, knowing he works late on a Thursday and I didn't even get asked if I minded sorting them out, same last Saturday, it's starting to be assumed that I'm OK with it,

I made a comment to him last night about how if I had fell asleep like I was hoping too they wouldn't of actually eaten, told him next time that I'm not doing it, just hope I stick to it. He's said he's going to tidy today but I'll believe that if it happens.

I always worry that if I keep asking them to do things they'll stop coming round and then that's on me, their last SM was horrible to them to the point that they didn't see their dad because of her, I just can't figure out where to place the line for them to not cross before I flip out.

I have the ability to completely over think things and make up scenarios that may or may not happen, sometimes its handy in the sense that I won't do something on the chance it will go wrong and play things safe, sometimes it's not because I'll miss out on things.

It maybe worth giving citizens advice a call or pop to an open morning as they can direct you to reccomended family solicitors and ones where you can get a free appointment so you know roughly what will happen next, I don't think they will be open much over the christmas period and unfortunately if you go to a drop in you maybe sat for a while so the earliest you can get there the better, I'm also in the UK and have had to go to them for advice myself before in regards to family law, thankfully for you over here grandparents don't have rights and I'm sure once the evidence has been put forward in any legal setting they won't have a chance and your sons dad will struggle whilst he is under their roof, if you need anymore advice for citizens advice or need help finding anyone, or even just for a rant I'm more than happy to help/listen if you need to.

Here's a link to their [family](https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/family/) page so you can have a read through whilst waiting to see them, if there's something you don't understand or need more help on then they will help the best they can and I've found they are understanding and listen to what you say, which at times like this can mean the most.

I ask them to tidy their rooms whilst I am cleaning as I like to show them that in also tidying too, we've just booked a holiday for 2021 and I've brought a diary, we sat down with them the other night and told them, also explained that if they want any spending money for the holiday they will need to help more at home, starting in the new year I will be keeping track of who has helped with what and doing a weekly/monthly total,

If you need anymore advice then please don't hesitate, I work nights myself so if you're awake at 2am and feel lonely or need someone to talk to I'll be one of the many awake that are more than happy to help,

Also check schpock and gumtree, here in the UK I don't thing craigslist is as big, facebook marketplace is one and there's freecycle, when I got emergency housed a week before christmas I had nothing but my sons things, I was sleeping on the floor for the first night so he had a bed, I managed to get a sofa, microwave, fridge and an oven, some people are more than happy to help especially this close to christmas, you don't have to tell everyone what's happened but people will help.

Please don't waste your money in a restaurant, if you have a kettle in the hotel pot noodles are handy, I survived on shop brand pot noodle sandwiches for a while, they can get boring and bland and sometimes need more sauce in but its something, if they've put you in somewhere like a travelodge unfortunately they aren't allowed to heat anything up for you or store anything for you in a fridge so it makes things a bit more difficult, they maybe able to signpost you to a food bank and they'll be able to help a bit more, sorry to jump on your posts a lot but I genuinely want to help having been in a similar situation, if you was close to me I'd offer a hot meal for you both and a day out of the hotel as I know what 4 walls can do to your mind.

WRITING.TITLE: Divorce and child access.
WRITING.TEXT: Not sure if I'll be able to get any advice but thought I'd try, me and my 'husband' have been separated for nearly 6 years, we have an 8yr old son together, I was the one who left him, I left my son living with him and his parents due to me having no where to go, no family and would of been put in hostels by the local council, I didn't want to put our son through that as I didn't want to unsettle him, over the years he has stopped me using our son if he disagrees with something for example one year me and my friend went on holiday over his (ex's) birthday in April, I had discussed it the previous December that I thought he would want to spend time with him on his birthday as he had requested over previous years and he agreed, the day I was due to fly out he kicked off and stopped me seeing him for 3 weeks after I got back 4 days later, he hasn't done so for about 3-4years but I'm scared that he will do it again. My problem is that on christmas and our sons birthday he changes how things are, we agreed last year that I would have him for his birthday and he would he at his dads for christmas and change it round this year and keep to it for years to come, this was so I could visit my family over christmas for the first time in 10 years amd over 2 hours away as I was alone due to leaving a bad relationship to which he agreed, Christmas this year comes around, I'm still under the agreement thought that he would be with me all Christmas, 2 weeks before his dad said no and that he would be with me christmas afternoon and boxing day, a week before he changed it to that he's with me christmas eve and morning, giving his usual threats I didn't feel confident in arguing back as I didn't want him stopping access again, There is no legal paperwork for agreements and I'm wanting to get this drawn up with potentially having my son full time with him getting access (there is issues there that will help me in doing so but would take up another story) and to get a divorce, how do I go about this? I know it will be a lengthy battle and I'm fully prepared for the emotional and mental attacks I'll receive from him and his family, I just don't know who to contact for help, how to go forward or realistic costs of doing so. I apologise for any mistakes on this post as I'm on my phone. Edit: I live in Yorkshire.

We have 50/50 over my son, they've put it in his head that his dad cannot live and will be lonely without him (son lives with his dad and his grandad) his dad doesn't work, sits gaming all day, my son has told me loads that he's asked him to take him to the park but he comes up with some excuse and sits him in front of a console instead, He has said many times that he wants to come live with me and my partner but when he tells his dad this they start with the emotional again, when he's here we go out and do educational and fun things, I take him to his swimming lessons every week, me and my partner went on holiday in October so he missed 2 weeks of lessons he's asked his dad and grandad to take him so he wouldn't miss them but they didn't and came up with more excuses, I pay for them so they wouldn't of had to spend any money it would of taken up less than an hour of their Saturday morning, they bad mouth me in front of him and when my son tells them they are wrong and corrects them on things they tell him that he doesn't know anything as he's only a child, if I have an issue with his dad I wait until he's in bed to talk to my partner about it.

My son was asking to come stay with me more often, I got a new job which took me from working 40-50hrs a week over 5 days, having every other weekend off to 22hrs, over 3 nights and having every weekend off so it kind of just happened, his dad hasn't disagreed about any of it, he's here most of half terms as well and hardly ever wants to go back.
Oh sorry, it was between us, we haven't gone down any legal routes which is why he has the upper hand to which I want to get sorted out legally.
I'm fully prepared for the battle, I just don't know where to start.

I only want to do what's best for our son and his views and feelings with come first 100% I just need some kind of agreement in legal writing just don't know who I need to contact whether it be solicitors, mediators or someone else.
Even if it means my son not living with me, I just need some legal paperwork so my ex cannot switch everything last minute again or try to stop me seeing him again.

This is what I needed to hear thank you! I don't ask my son about anything when he's at his dads, we'll be talking about something completely different lole a tv programme or what to have for lunch and he'll randomly bring things up during conversation to which I try to brush over and go back to topic as quick as possible, I don't discuss things around him that can be taken back to his dads or that will put thoughts in his mind, these are discussed with my partner when he's at his dads or when he is in bed asleep, the relationship that I left over 2 years ago was bad for me, my son was never around or part of the reasons as to why it went wrong and his dad knows of nothing of why that relationship ended. I only want what's best for him, I have messages from his dad in regards the times he used to threaten/stop me seeing him, I have contacted citizens advice before and seen a solicitor and shown them messages and explained the best I could have to which they have told me it won't help him as it shows him as being petty for his reasoning, I just want my son to be happy and for us all to know where we stand on agreements legally.

If it's at all feasible then of course I do but if that's not best for him then my feelings do not matter, what matters is that my son is happy and knows he is loved, I want to get a divorce but cannot do so until we have come to an agreement with the courts over access etc.

Again, I understand that and I have explained that all I want is for him to be happy and something legal that can stop the ex from me seeing our son which will be more detrimental to our relationship.

If it was an option then yes, who wouldn't? But as I keep saying I want what's best for him and our relationship. I'm sorry but I don't feel like I'm getting any advice from you which is why I posted as I don't know which avenues I need to go down to get access on paper.

I've had this problem last night, I've reset and cleaned them, still not working, I've just got off online chat with customer support, they're sending someone out to collect it so they can take it away and see what's going on and repair as its still under warranty, I googled it last night to see if there was any easy fixes and it appears it's a common occurrence for a fair few people within the last 2 months, no one has a fix for it unfortunately. Edit to say it's also my left one,

I'm not sure if I'm honest, maybe worth jumping on the online chat and seeing what they say or if you have a store near you to pop in to, I'd of thought if it was a software issue they'll of had an update or something by now, I should have them back next week, hopefully fixed and working.
Did you get them free when you got your phone or did you purchase separately?

Update for me, they got picked up Thursday, came back today, they've replaced them for a new pair, I've had no contact from them to say they was going to replace or what was up with them, I'd definitely suggest getting onto them for repair if you're within warranty, they never asked me for proof of purchase though.

If you go online to the CSA page there is a calculator, it will ask you for income, how many nights a year she stays at yours etc, use this as a guideline, if it's less I'd approach her mum with the screenshot of what it says and bring up the subject of how often she is with you and money, you cannot afford to fund both households if she's mainly at yours, as for her being in the living room all the time even for sleeping, that needs to stop, especially with a baby on the way, have you tried to sit her down and talk to her about how it's a living space and not a sleeping space? Ask if there is anything that's putting her off sleeping in her own bed, you need to set some boundaries ASAP because the more you put it off, the harder it becomes. Explain how you need some down time after work and that a film is for watching to be able to relax and still spend time together, is there any activities or after school clubs she could go to? That also could help with her need to be around people.

Firstly you shouldn't have paypal at 14, signing up to paypal becomes a legally binding contract to which you need to be 18+ to use it, secondly you'll need to contact paypal in regards to understand what has made the account go to the debt collectors and also contact Wescot to get more information from them. Unfortunately for you the only way to sort this is to admit your age to them.

Be warned, because you're underage they may possibly suspend your account and ask to speak to your parents in regards and if it is found to be your debt you will still be liable to pay for it, I'm assuming you lied about your age whilst signing up?
Kids are off to the park so means I'll have peace and quiet without hearing shouts at FIFA in one room and shouts at Fortnite in the other.
It may show as being in debt as the debt has been passed on to the collection agency so technically you now do not owe paypal but you owe Wescot.
PayPal have the rights to try to get you to pay the balance due, not knowing you were a minor when you opened the account. It's on their website.

NTA, I lost my mum when I was a teen, I was then fostered by her friend who had 4 children of her own, they had holidays etc with their grandparents, at first I felt a bit left out but after I a couple of months I realised that they are their grandparents, not mine and I was happy for them to have the experiences they have had in life. I'm going to take the hit and say YTA, I understand where you're coming from, I have a very very unique name, even when I Google it there is nothing, it always gets pronounced incorrectly and I'm constantly asked what country I'm from and what language I talk and its pisses me off no end, I'm British and can only speak English, I'm always having to correct someone after telling them how to say it numerous times, but it's the name I was given by my mother, she died when I was 14, I had to change my last name legally at one point after her passing (long story) and I also considered changing ny first name, after a long time deciding I realised that it was a name she chose for me, after 16yrs I'm glad I kept my name as since then I've lost a lot of things that remind me of her, it's the one thing that I still get to feel close to her whilst remembering the conversations about why she chose my name, where it came from and what it means, your parents gave you your name for a reason, whether you like it or not there is worse things in life and I'm fully with her when she says she feels disrespected and upset that you have done this. NAL but had previously worked for a car insurance provider, if you escalate it and ask them for a copy of your comparison quote (I can't remember the terminology they use) that they're basing this on, it can take a while to come through but it will prove that no conviction was added when you ran the quote, they cannot use an old quote for this policy if it was a different quote that you continued to create the policy with, any payments that are taken should be refunded to you once this has been rectified and any admin fee's refunded as well since it isn't you that made a change, in my previous employment they would send an email asking for the proof, a letter and a text msg at the same time giving you 14 days, and repeated again at 7 days, with 3 days to go they will again send you an email and a text, I'm not sure if other insurers are the same. It's not down the insurer to prove it, its down to yourself to prove otherwise. I apologise for formatting, I'm on mobile and half asleep.

Yorkie here! I've lived in Lincolnshire for some of my life so my accent can be a bit mixed at times, for example I say bath, glass, last, grass and garage 'posh' apparently along with other words, when I meet new people I always get told I can't be from here cos I don't sound 'proper Yorkshire' its like they seem to think that we all sound like those from Heartbeat, where the heart is, Emmerdale and last of the summer wine (I know they're old programmes, just an example)

I lived near Cromer and in Kings Lynn (sarcastic yay) previously for a short time, I must admit I was pleasantly surprised when the locals didn't sound all farmer and pleased that I could understand them.

I elongate the a so bath sounds like barth, glass as glarse etc, my OH and kids always pretend not to understand me if I say one of those words and tell me talk properly, it annoys me so much at times other times I manage to think ahead and speak 'properly'

Previous to living there I always got the impression from TV etc that it was all the broad accent spoken, I found near Sheringham it was spoken more along the retired but still not as strong as I had expected.
I find similar here, usually its part of the word that gets missed, pronounced completely different or middle letters so 'get over here' would be 'git oer ere' gets confusing at times even to me.

Did you ever link your xbox to your email account with its serial number? I recently did this out of curiosity to find out when/if my warranty had expired. Just an idea in case it does progress further and the police say that you'll get the xbox back and they get the money, that way you know for sure its your xbox and not one that they already had that had stopped working, to which they'd claim the faulty one is the one you sold. If they carry on tell them you have made the police aware and if they still feel like you 'scammed' them that you'd be more than happy to give them the incident number if they so wish, if it is a scam then they'll probably just give you some more abuse and disappear as they won't want police sniffing around especially if they are dodgy. Edit to add [link](https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/help/18878/microsoft-xbox-device-registration-process) for device registration.

Also if you do sell in the future, shpock has PayPal option to pay if you want an item and is legally binding once a sale has been confirmed and some protection against this kinda thing, I haven't read the full t amp;cs so maybe worth a look into if you have things in the future to sell.

Glad to hear! If it comes to it and you need it, at least you can prove its the same xbox, if you do end up having to trade back double check the xbox warranty seals haven't been broken and for any damage that may of happened, I'm assuming you still have the pics from the ad to show what condition it was in so it all helps.

But it shows the xbox has been linked to your account previously and is the correct xbox if they try and pull a switcheroo as you'll be able to check the serial number on the back of the xbox, you're not an idiot, not a lot of people think about these things, hopefully they'll leave you alone once they realise you aren't giving in, bonus is that you dropped it off and they didn't collect so they don't know where you live to continue the harassment.

WRITING.TITLE: Missing trust fund? Where do I go from here?
WRITING.TEXT: Not quite sure where to start if I have any legal stand or where to go for help on this matter, I apologise for any mistakes in my post, emotions are high and I'm a bit confused on what to do, So to start, my mum died when I was 14, I have only just got a copy of her will, I was to go to my uncle (mums brother) and his wife after her passing, they where appointed to be trustees of my mums estate and to divide it between me and my brother, I was to be able to access this when I turned 19, it states in the will that it was ' lt;20k' I have not heard nor seen anything about this trust fund, I'm not on good terms with said trustees as my aunt constantly blamed everything on me after I moved in, told people she couldn't cope with me and that I was a handful, she then shipped me off within 2wks of my mum passing to live with my nan, my uncle (I'll call him Uncle T) and his then partner (by packing my things when I was at school, picking me up after and dumping me at my nans, I was unaware this was to happen) My mum also stated in her will I was not to live with uncle T under any circumstances, I was a grieveing 14yr old who had been moved away from everyone and everything I knew the day after she passed (moved from north to south, at least 2hrs drive) marched up to the newsagents the day of moving to get a paper round and then the day after I was in a new school, I am now 30, do I have a leg to stand on if I decided to find out about if there is any trust that I am owed? How do I find out if there is in fact anything? My brother received nothing also. Again I'm sorry if nothing makes sense, its all a bit mushed in my mind and I'm still trying to process new found information in regards to this and other parts of my life since. Edit: forgot to add I live in England.

I was with them for about a month, I don't have any contact with them, I don't know where they live anymore, I could ask my nan but she would ask questions and to be honest from my mum's will and social services/court papers I have also obtained, she's lied about a lot of things so I don't think she would tell me as the uncle I lived with and Uncle T are blue eyed boys with no faults (criminal convictions state otherwise) I'm going to read through again and again to figure it out best I can and then head to a solicitor for clarification, I can't afford a full sit down and explain so I want to go with the main points the best I can if that makes sense?

This was my worry, I was thinking of heading to a solicitor first and get advice, then find a way to contact them and ask when I know what options I have, I currently live a few hours away so unfortunately I can't just pop round to the last known address, I have no contact number for them either,
